title: PlayStation Plus January 2026 games announced: Need for Speed Unbound, Disney Epic Mickey and more
snippet: Sony has announced the PlayStation Plus Monthly Games for January 2026, featuring Need for Speed Unbound, Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed and Core Keeper. Players can enjoy high-speed racing, magical adventures and deep underground exploration from January 6.

title: I used these five gadgets to boost my productivity last year: here’s why you should try them in 2026
snippet: I used these 5 gadgets to boost my productivity in 2025. From e-readers to smartwatches, check out the complete list of gadgets.&nbsp;

title: Bharat Taxi received ‘very good’ response in soft launch, full launch by end of January: Govt
snippet: The government-backed Bharat Taxi app will launch by January's end in Delhi and other cities. It received positive feedback during its soft launch, with 5,500 daily rides and over 1.4 lakh registered drivers

title: Sridhar Vembu announces Arattai expansion to Android TV with New Year update: How to install, features and more
snippet: The Arattai messaging app has launched on Android TV, allowing users to join meetings and enjoy video calls on a larger screen. It necessitates Android 7 or later, with USB support for connecting to camera or microphone.

title: Elon Musk says Neuralink plans high-volume brain chip production, automated surgery in 2026
snippet: Elon Musk's Neuralink plans to start high-volume production of brain-computer interface devices in 2026, utilizing automated procedures. The device, implanted in 12 individuals so far, is currently aimed at enhancing communication for those with severe disabilities.

title: Instagram head warns AI-generated content will overwhelm feeds, says ‘fingerprinting real media more practical than…’
snippet: Instagram Head Adam Mosseri predicts a rise in AI-generated content, leading to skepticism about media authenticity.He also predicts that platforms will face pressure to label AI content as technology advances in mimicking reality.

title: 3D Figurines to AI hairstyles: Google shares top Nano Banana trends of 2025 with detailed prompts
snippet: Google has shared some of the top trends that users generated using its Nano Banana and Nano Banana Pro models in 2025.&nbsp;

title: Upcoming smartphone launches expected in January 2026: OnePlus Turbo, Realme 16 Pro and more

title: iPhone 11 Pro now vintage: Apple updates obsolete and vintage product list
snippet: Apple has updated its vintage and obsolete product list, adding the iPhone 11 Pro, Apple Watch Series 5 and more. While these devices still work, official repairs are now limited, signalling the gradual end of long-term support.

title: New Year 2026 cinematic portraits made easy: 5 Top AI prompts for ChatGPT, Gemini, and Grok
snippet: Celebrate New Year 2026 with cinematic AI portraits! Here is how you can turn your selfies into hyper-realistic, high-fashion visuals with fireworks, luxury outfits, and festive vibes. Here are five viral AI prompts for stunning, social-media-ready portraits on ChatGPT, Gemini, Grok and more.

title: Even the sky may not be the limit for AI data centres
snippet: AI leaders believe Earth may soon lack the power and space for data centres, pushing them to look skyward. Big tech figures are backing the idea of building computing hubs in orbit, despite huge costs and doubts. Supporters say it is inevitable, while critics call it unrealistic.

title: In the beauty game, quick commerce's serving all the looks
snippet: Quick commerce is reshaping India’s beauty market, with skincare and makeup now bought on impulse and delivered in minutes rather than planned online shopping. title: Decoding Gen Z’s experience-first new commerce playbook
snippet: ​​The digitally-native Gen Z’s willingness to adopt unique, frictionless services is quietly shaping a new model of commerce. Businesses must understand this 377 million-strong cohort if they want to centre innovation on its specific needs.

title: Knight Fintech secures $23.6 million from Accel, IIFL, & others
snippet: Knight Fintech has raised $23.6 million in a funding round led by early-stage venture firm Accel, with participation from IIFL and Rocket Capital. Existing investors Prime Venture Partners, 3One4 Capital, Commerce VC, and Trifecta Capital also participated in the round.

title: Zomato strike backed by ‘0.1% miscreants’, says CEO Deepinder Goyal
snippet: Eternal CEO Deepinder Goyal said gig workers are not exploited, adding that a small group of terminated riders disrupted operations by forcibly preventing others from working.
